sources.title: Rebecca
sources.description: Title: Rebecca Summary: A self-conscious bride is tormented by the memory of her husband's dead first wife. Directed by: Alfred Hitchcock Actors: Laurence Olivier, Joan Fontaine, George Sanders Production Company: Selznick International Pictures Release Date: 12 April 1940 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 A shy lady's companion, staying in Monte Carlo with her stuffy employer, meets the wealthy Maxim de Winter. She and Max fall in love, marry and return to Manderley, his large country estate in Cornwall. Max is still troubled by the death of his first wife, Rebecca, in a boating accident the year before. The second Mrs. de Winter clashes with the housekeeper, Mrs. Danvers, and discovers that Rebecca still has a strange hold on everyone at Manderley.

metadata.Plot: A shy lady's companion, staying in Monte Carlo with her stuffy employer, meets the wealthy Maxim de Winter (Sir Laurence Olivier). She and Max fall in love, marry, and return to Manderley, his large country estate in Cornwall. Max is still troubled by the death of his first wife, Rebecca, in a boating accident the year before. The second Mrs. de Winter (Joan Fontaine) clashes with the housekeeper, Mrs. Danvers (Dame Judith Anderson), and discovers that Rebecca still has a strange hold on everyone at Manderley.
metadata.Writer: Daphne Du Maurier, Robert E. Sherwood, Joan Harrison
metadata.Actors: Laurence Olivier, Joan Fontaine, George Sanders
